title: Every Book Our Cookbook Club Has Cooked Through
description: Since the Food52 Cookbook Club launched as a Facebook Group in 2017, we've cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—nearly 40,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo. The way our members cook together across continents and time zones is simple: We post pics and reviews of the recipes we make from one of our chosen books. This could mean our "Book of the Month," our annual "Bonus Book," or any past cookbook we've covered for a Throwback Thursday or Throwback Month (August and February) post. Even if you can't get your hands on your own copy, we make sure you can still cook along with us, by excerpting recipes from our chosen cookbooks and only selecting titles that you can also download to a device. Read More >>
author: Food52
excerpt: Food52's Cookbook Club has cooked through nearly 100 books—and counting—since it launched in 2017. Use this list of all the titles we've covered for inspo and to cook along during on our "Throwback" months and "Throwback Thursdays."
text: Since the Food52 Cookbook Club launched as a Facebook Group in 2017, we've cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—nearly 40,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo. The way our members cook together across continents and time zones is simple: We post pics and reviews of the recipes we make from one of our chosen books. This could mean our "Book of the Month," our annual "Bonus Book," or any past cookbook we've covered for a Throwback Thursday or Throwback Month (August and February) post. Even if you can't get your hands on your own copy, we make sure you can still cook along with us, by excerpting recipes from our chosen cookbooks and only selecting titles that you can also download to a device. We also lean on each other for answers to cooking questions in our comments and in AMAs with featured cookbook authors. And we help members get together for their own IRL cookbook club meetups. Join us here and follow us on Instagram at @f52cookbookclub. And if baking is also your thing—or more your style—check out our Baking Club, too, and every cookbook they've covered. Below is the full list of cookbooks our club has covered—plus the titles we're cooking through next. You can also see the entire list of books (and search the recipe indexes) on Eat Your Books here. Sign up for free to access it—to organize and build your own shelf, get your first month free with code FOOD5224. Bonus Book: Veg Forward: Super-Delicious Recipes that Put Produce at the Center of Your Plate by Susan Spungen January: Made in Taiwan: Recipes and Stories from the Island Nation by Clarissa Wei and Ivy Chen February: Happy Birthday Cookbook + Baking Clubs! All previously covered books are fair game. html:
Since the Food52 Cookbook Club launched as a Facebook Group in 2017, we've cooked through nearly 100 cookbooks together. To make the titles easy to find for our new and current members—nearly 40,000 and counting!—we're listing them here for easy access and inspo.

The way our members cook together across continents and time zones is simple: We post pics and reviews of the recipes we make from one of our chosen books. This could mean our "Book of the Month," our annual "Bonus Book," or any past cookbook we've covered for a Throwback Thursday or Throwback Month (August and February) post. Even if you can't get your hands on your own copy, we make sure you can still cook along with us, by excerpting recipes from our chosen cookbooks and only selecting titles that you can also download to a device.

We also lean on each other for answers to cooking questions in our comments and in AMAs with featured cookbook authors. And we help members get together for their own IRL cookbook club meetups. Join us here and follow us on Instagram at @f52cookbookclub. And if baking is also your thing—or more your style—check out our Baking Club, too, and every cookbook they've covered.

Below is the full list of cookbooks our club has covered—plus the titles we're cooking through next. You can also see the entire list of books (and search the recipe indexes) on Eat Your Books here. Sign up for free to access it—to organize and build your own shelf, get your first month free with code FOOD5224.

Bonus Book: Veg Forward: Super-Delicious Recipes that Put Produce at the Center of Your Plate by Susan Spungen

January: Made in Taiwan: Recipes and Stories from the Island Nation by Clarissa Wei and Ivy Chen

February: Happy Birthday Cookbook + Baking Clubs! All previously covered books are fair game.

March: Kachka: A Return to Russian Cooking by Bonnie Frumkin Morales

Bonus Book: Tenderheart: A Cookbook About Vegetables and Unbreakable Family Bonds by Hetty Lui McKinnon.

January: Veg-table: Recipes, Techniques, and Plant Science for Big-Flavored, Vegetable-Centered Meals by Nik Sharma

February: Happy 7th Birthday Cookbook Clubs! Any previously covered book is fair game.

July: Zaytinya: Delicious Mediterranean Dishes from Greece, Turkey, and Lebanon by José Andrés

Nov./Dec. Bonus Book: The One-Bottle Cocktail: More than 80 Recipes with Fresh Ingredients and a Single Spirit by Maggie Hoffman

2023 bonus books: Ruffage: A Practical Guide to Vegetables, Grist: A Practical Guide to Cooking Grains, Beans, Seeds, and Legumes, Pulp : A Practical Guide to Cooking with Fruit, all by Abra Berens

December: Cook, Eat, Repeat: Ingredients, Recipes, and Stories By Nigella Lawson.
